status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
get the following error when trying to run the app on device:

[ERROR] :  Error details: Provisioning profile "generic" doesn't include signing certificate "iPhone Developer: Ilay Sener (QT9JARYJ64)".
[ERROR] :  Error details: Code signing is required for product type 'Application' in SDK 'iOS 10.3'


I was able to package and upload the app and install it on the device, but not able to run my app on the phone for testing from the computer.

fields.summary: unable to run iOS app on device during development

comments.body: [~isener], I moved this issue to TIMOB project as it is not a TIDOC bug.

The error is an Xcode error, no Titanium one:
{quote}
 Provisioning profile "generic" doesn't include signing certificate "iPhone Developer: Ilay Sener (QT9JARYJ64)".
{quote}
It basically means that your provisioning profile is not signed for the your developer account. You need to invalidate it via the iOS dev-portal and re-assign it to your developer certificate. Ensure that you have the private key of the account in your keychain.

*EDIT*: And it might work via Xcode because it will select a managed certificate by default.
*EDIT 2*: You state that you use the "SDK 6.2.1" which does not exist. Either 6.0.4 (latest GA), 6.1.0 (latest pre-release / RC) or 6.2.0 (master).

Hi Guys,

The reason why this wasn't working is simply because I had multiple profiles and wasn't able to select the profile to run the app on the device.

After a little research, I have found a way to delete the other profiles, which I am not able to from Studio. Then it was all fine.

Perhaps, it would be a good idea to enable which profile to use to run the app when testing on the device.
